results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 3. Season 1. Eps 10-13
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Pino Amenta, Ray Boseley, Stephen Johnson, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Disney Channel Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 10: When a stranger arrives at Catalyst with a new game he claims to have invented, Alex is eager to invest in it. When Mike discovers the game is stolen he teams up with Pi to save Alex from embarrassment. Episode 11: Marcello and Mike are forced to face some home truths about people they have idolised. Episode 12: After Marcello throws Catalyst into panic when he hacks into the computer system, the rest of the kids have to decide where to place their allegiances - with Marcello or Alex. Episode 13: When Virgil is ‘captured’ by opposing games company Sunijim, Marcello attempts to redeem himself in Alex’s eyes by rescuing him. After he also runs into difficulties the friends use their computer skills to save them both and reunite the Crash Zone team. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 2. Season 1. Eps 06-09
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Pino Amenta, Ray Boseley, Stephen Johnson, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Disney Channel Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 6: When Bec begins a ‘Net romance’ the boys are sceptical. Their worst fears are realised when they discover that it is Virgil, their A.I. friend that is wooing her. Episode 7: Bec and Pi have differences of opinion when they design a game for girls about teenage romance. The resulting mess causes the team to acknowledge they still have a lot to learn about emotions and life. Episode 8: When a reporter arrives at Catalyst to do a story on the testers, they have suspicions she may be a spy. Pi, who has led the gang to believe she is a street kid, is unmasked when her mother tracks her to the company. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 1. Season 1. Eps 01-05
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Pino Amenta, Ray Boseley, Stephen Johnson, Patricia Edgar, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Disney Channel Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 1: Mike, Pi, Bec, Marcello and Ram all decipher a coded message on the net which leads them to Catalyst software where they are offered the job of their dreams - testing video games after school. Episode 2: While testing a video game the kids encounter Virgil, an artificial intelligence that lives inside the Internet, and uncover his origins. Episode 3: When Alex, the head of Catalyst, loses her necklace, the gang comes under suspicion. At the same time Marcello’s little sister is lost on the streets, giving the friends two cases to solve. Episode 4: Master inventor and the youngest of the group Ram, gets more than he bargained for when he sells one of his adventures to a strange girl. Episode 5: A computer virus invades Catalyst threatening the company’s computer systems. The team is tense after Mike fails to defend Bec when his friends make racist comments to her. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Risks and wrongs (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “Teenagers’ guide to the galaxy”.
Part of a series developed for young people aged 9-16 which deals with issues of communication skills, interpersonal skills, life skills and problem solving. “Risks and wrongs” explores risk-taking, or illegal activities such as stealing or vandalism, and peer pressure among teenagers. Includes hints and advice from teenagers, police and other adults on issues such as being assertive; saying ‘no’; image amongst peers; friends - real or otherwise; actions and consequences; responsibility. Features Colette Mann as Fay.

results.title: Making a good impression (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Teenagers’ guide to the galaxy”.
Part of a series developed for young people aged 9-16 which deals with issues of communication skills, interpersonal skills, life skills and problem solving. “Making a good impression” discusses what is required to impress others, particularly when applying for a job. Includes hints and advice by teenagers and adults on appearance; manners and etiquette; respect for yourself and others; initiative; preparation; confidence. Features Colette Mann as Fay.

results.title: Assertive with adults (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Teenagers’ guide to the galaxy”.
Part of a series developed for young people aged 9-16 which deals with issues of communication skills, interpersonal skills, life skills and problem solving. “Assertive with adults” focuses on ways of negotiating with parents, teachers and other adults to achieve a satisfactory, or win-win, outcome. Includes personal hints and advice from adults and teenagers such as choosing the right time; listen to what the adult is saying; expressing clearly your wants and needs; negotiating and being prepared to compromise. Features Colette Mann as Fay.

results.title: Reach for the stars (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Teenagers’ guide to the galaxy”.
Part of a series developed for young people aged 9-16 which deals with issues of communication skills, interpersonal skills, life skills and problem solving. “Reach for the stars” is all about your potential, your future and what you will be doing for the rest of your life. It discusses how you can help achieve that path to success or make your dreams come true and includes hints and worldly advice from teenagers and adults about decision-making; career choices; motivation; setting goals; initiative; self belief and potential. Features Colette Mann as Fay.

results.title: Bad girls. Series one
results.creator_credit: Brian Park and Shed Productions (Jailbirds) Ltd
results.brief_description: Inspired by the success of Australia’s “Prisoner” comes the British production of “Bad girls”, also set in a woman’s only prison. Governor of G Ward is Helen Stewart (Simone Lahbib), a boss with a conscience unafraid of standing up for the rights of the prisoners. The core group of women comprise of: Rachel (Joanne Froggatt), first timer, victimised and vulnerable, Shell (Debra Stephenson), a lifer and the toughest woman on the ward, Denny (Alicia Eyo), Shell’s faithful sidekick and occasional lover, Nikki (Mandana Jones) a thinking lesbian who isn’t afraid to speak her mind and has unresolved sexual tension with the Governor, and the Julies, 2 women called Julie fond of finishing one another’s sentences. An engrossing mix of violence inflicted by women towards women and the inadequacies of the prison system, it also attempts to capture the vagary of relationships and emotions experienced by women who share confined quarters and are without civil liberties. Devised by Maureen Chadwick, Eileen Gallagher and Ann McManus, this award winning series is now in its 5th season. For more information, visit the official website http://www.badgirls.co.uk

results.title: Bad girls. Series one. Discs 3 & 4
results.creator_credit: Brian Park and Shed Productions (Jailbirds) Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bad girls. Series one”.
Playing with fire (wri. Ann McManus, dir. Jim O’Hanlon): Zandra’s under pressure from Shell to find her stash of smuggled drugs and is quick to drop in Warden Rose. Nikki moves in next door to Shell and Lorna’s career is in jeopardy. Shell has her privileges stripped. “Falling apart” (wri. Sally Wainwright, dir. Mike Adams): Shell uses her powers of sexual persuasion to get back into the threes. The Louises get into wine making and Monica receives devastating news. “Pay back time” (wri. Martin Allen, dir. Mike Adams): Lorna returns from holidays, Monica’s still not speaking and Shell claims she’s come off drugs and found religion. She also vows to settle a score with Lorna. Helen struggles to resist Nikki’s charms. “Love hurts” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Mike Adams): Monica’s appeal nears. New prisoner Yvonne Atkins (Linda Henry) is making a good impression on the women and is full of lots of inventive ideas for improvement. There’s tension between Helen and Nikki and Helen’s having second thoughts about her impending marriage.
